metadata.title: CVE-2018-5132 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The Find API for WebExtensions can search some privileged pages, such as"about:debugging", if these pages are open in a tab. This could allow amalicious WebExtension to search for otherwise protected data if a user hasit open. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 59.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5132` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 59.0+build5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 59.0+build5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 59.0+build5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 59.0+build5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '59.0+build5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
